reviews.text:
Yep, lots of stairs and ramps, but great views of the city. There are plenty of seats and shade as well. Also water fountains. Not to many people either.
And yes it's free.
Hidden gem.
The best park in the city, but it has many ups and downs for people who are not in a good physical shape!
Great place to walk, with great views over the city, some good little restaurants nearby and had a nice little playground for the younger kids.

Found this park by accident when just wondering around and must say I'm glad I did. It's a hidden gem.

Its a lovely park with many species of plants and flowers. If you make it to the top, the views over Barcelona are absolutely spectacular. 

But the best thing about this place? the complete lack of people. When I visited I saw one other person in the park. There was no-one there to ruin the peace and quiet, and I was free to enjoy the amazing views in peace.

Situated on the slopes of the Putxet Hill, these beautiful gardens offer a stunning number of various species, some of them quite rare, and amazing views on the city. It is not quite a relaxing walk, due to the stairs that seems to be everywhere, but it is a rewarding visit.

Came here after visiting parque guell and not being able to enter the main park. It was a lovely walk, and unbelievable views of the city. A huge contrast to the busy park guell, so worth the visit if your looking for something off the beaten track! 
Be aware: lots of steps, but views from the top worth every one.

These gardens are not far from Park Guell near Gracia and Sarria and offer a peaceful park to walk around for a couple hours for those who want something less touristy than Park Guell. The views from the top of the garden are phenomenal allowing you to see all of the city on one side and Tibidabo and the surrounding mountains on the other
